alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Clarke; Jackson; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 7:32PM EDT until June 03 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Barrow County in north central Georgia... Clarke County in northeastern Georgia... Southeastern Jackson County in northeastern Georgia... Northwestern Oconee County in northeastern Georgia... * Until 145 AM EDT Friday. * At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Athens, Statham, Winterville, Bogart, Bethlehem, Athens-Clarke County, Bear Creek Reservoir, Westgate Park, Oconee Heights, Beechwood Hills, James Holland Youth Sports Cmpx, Sandy Creek Recreation Area, Barretts Mill and Russell. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
